verses.text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
verses.comment: The listing of Jacob's (Israel's) sons matches genealogical lists in Genesis.

verses.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.comment: Completes the enumeration of the twelve sons of Israel.

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bath-shua, a Canaanite woman. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was evil in the sight of the LORD, so He put him to death.
verses.comment: Conforms to the account in Genesis 38; Bath-shua is also known as Shuah’s daughter.

verses.text: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, gave birth to Perez and Zerah by him. All the sons of Judah were five.
verses.comment: Tamar’s story is summarized succinctly, as in the original Hebrew.

verses.text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
verses.comment: Faithful to the genealogical listings in Genesis.

verses.text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five in all.
verses.comment: Some Hebrew manuscripts read 'Darda' instead of 'Dara'.

verses.text: The son of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who broke faith regarding the devoted thing.
verses.comment: 'Achar' is another form of 'Achan.'

verses.text: The son of Ethan: Azariah.
verses.comment: A short genealogical note.

verses.text: The sons of Hezron who were born to him: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
verses.comment: 'Chelubai' is another name for Caleb.

verses.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the sons of Judah;
verses.comment: Follows genealogies also found in Ruth and Numbers.

verses.text: and Nahshon became the father of Salmon, and Salmon became the father of Boaz,
verses.comment: Direct line leading to Boaz, common ancestor in messianic lineage.

verses.text: Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;
verses.comment: Jesse was the father of David.

verses.text: and Jesse became the father of Eliab his firstborn, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,
verses.comment: Sons as listed in Samuel.

verses.text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
Ozem the sixth, David the seventh.
verses.comment: Elsewhere (1 Sam. 16:10–11) David is the eighth son; the difference probably reflects variant traditions.

verses.text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel—three.
verses.comment: Zeruiah and Abigail are Jesse's daughters.

verses.text: Abigail gave birth to Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
Caleb the son of Hezron fathered children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. Her sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
verses.comment: Caleb here is also called Chelubai in v. 9.

verses.text: When Azubah died, Caleb took Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
Hur fathered Uri, and Uri fathered Bezalel.
verses.comment: Bezalel is the craftsman for the tabernacle (Exodus).

verses.text: After this, Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead. He married her when he was sixty years old, and she bore him Segub.
Segub fathered Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
But Geshur and Aram took from them Havvoth-jair, Kenath and its villages, sixty towns. All these were descendants of Machir, the father of Gilead.
After the death of Hezron in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, bore him Ashhur, the father of Tekoa.
The sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron: Ram, his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
Jerahmeel had another wife, named Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.
The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.
The sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.
The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. Sheshan had an Egyptian servant whose name was Jarha.
So Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to Jarha his servant, and she bore him Attai.
Attai fathered Nathan, and Nathan fathered Zabad;
Zabad fathered Ephlal, and Ephlal fathered Obed;
Obed fathered Jehu, and Jehu fathered Azariah;
Azariah fathered Helez, and Helez fathered Eleasah;
Eleasah fathered Sismai, and Sismai fathered Shallum;
Shallum fathered Jekamiah, and Jekamiah fathered Elishama.
The sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph. The sons of Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
verses.comment: This verse is compact due to difficult Hebrew structure; main ideas retained.

verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
Shema fathered Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem fathered Shammai.
The son of Shammai: Maon; Maon fathered Beth-Zur.
Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran fathered Gazez.
The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
She also bore Shaaph, the father of Madmannah, and Sheva, the father of Machbenah and of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim,
Salma, the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh (half of the Menuhoth),
verses.comment: Translation preserves apparent ambiguity in the Hebrew.

verses.text: and the clans of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half of the Manahathites, the Zorites,
verses.comment: Many place names; rendered as such.

verses.text: and the clans of scribes living at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
verses.comment: The Rechabites appear later in Jeremiah. Translation retains the listing style of the original.
